benchmark_details.name: UNCD-Cyber
benchmark_details.overview: UNCD-Cyber provides a detailed assessment of the removal of dangerous capabilities in LLMs using a fine-grained evaluation framework based on Cognitive Diagnosis Modeling.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To enhance the evaluation of LLM unlearning methods through fine-grained diagnostic assessments of harmful knowledge retention.

data.source: Open-source Cyber Threat Intelligence reports and tailored evaluation datasets based on MITRE ATT&CK techniques.
data.annotation: Generated using GPT-4o and reviewed by experts.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the assessment of knowledge concepts associated with the ability to perform cyberattacks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate greater effectiveness in unlearning harmful capabilities while retaining benign ones.
methodology.validation: Validation from responses collected during various unlearning methods.

targeted_risks.harm: Residual harmful capabilities resulting from ineffective unlearning methods.
